meanings.definition: A person who engages in arbitrage.
meanings.sent1: The arbitragers quickly buy and sell to make a profit.
meanings.sent2: Arbitragers take advantage of price differences to earn money.
meanings.sent3: The group of arbitragers raced to make deals before anyone else.
meanings.sent4: She was like an arbiter, but instead of judging, she was an arbiter of prices like the arbitragers.
meanings.sent5: The arbitragers were like financial detectives, always hunting for the best deals.

meanings.definition: Those who profit from the differences in price of the same asset in different markets.
meanings.sent1: The arbitragers made money by buying low in one market and selling high in another.
meanings.sent2: Arbitragers capitalize on price variations across various markets.
meanings.sent3: The arbitragers were like skilled treasure hunters seeking out the best prices.
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, arbitragers are like skilled surfers riding the waves of price differences.
meanings.sent5: The arbitragers' success depended on their ability to spot and exploit price gaps in markets.
